attributes.action: Stop parties from supplying 'helpful' questions to ask the PM.
attributes.background: The party in power circulates 'helpful' questions to ask the PM during PM's questions. The number of questions allowed to be asked is limited, therefore these 'helpful' questions are being asked instead of Mp's asking important constituency and national matters.
attributes.additional_details:
Inside the Commons 2015 Season 1 Episode 1 shows this point perfectly and the times stated below explains exactly what we need to stop to allow more important issues being brought up during PMQ's.

Yet another reason why the public feel so wary of politicians, they are constantly wasting time and squandering the chance to reply to real topics, purely for self-gratification.

40:33 - 43:55
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Bnq2cY299xs

attributes.action: Make free healthcare at the point of service a human right
attributes.background: One of the pieces of legislation of the current government is introducing a British bill of rights. The purpose of this petition is for one of those rights to be the right to free healthcare at the point of use.
attributes.additional_details: The purpose of this is to protect the NHS and prevent the privatization of our health service.

attributes.action: We in uk deserves a tax threshold raise from 11k to 68k whatever the income.
attributes.background: We don't mind paying tax. Just don't tax us before the 68k income limit PA. Sign this people it will help everyone.

attributes.action: Increase the Council Tax band values for England to acceptable & relevant levels
attributes.background:
Council Tax valuations are based on the value of properties.

The value is the price the property would have sold for on the open market on 1 April 1991 in England and 1 April 2003 in Wales. Properties were put into a band based on their value on those dates.
attributes.additional_details:
Current Council Tax bands in England (1 April 1991 values)
Band / Value
A	up to £40,000 
B	£40,001 to £52,000
C	£52,001 to £68,000
D	£68,001 to £88,000
E	£88,001 to £120,000
F	£120,001 to £160,000
G	£160,001 to £320,000
H	more than £320,000

https://www.gov.uk

The bands were set in 1991 when house prices were 1/4 of today's value.  Anyone moving house today unfairly falls in to band F,G or H and pays between £2400-£3600 in Tax. The Values/Band should now be quadrupled in line with house prices.

attributes.action: To rule out membership of the E.E.A
attributes.background: Following the vote on the U.K.'s membership of the E.U. there is much discussion about the way forward. One option is membership of the E.E.A. given the express desire of the public, in voting to leave, is to establish sovereignty and control of our boarders this option is unacceptable.

attributes.action: In an Indy ref 2, Scottish Regions that vote to remain in the uk should remain.
attributes.background: The SNP government have consistently said that it supports the will of the Scottish people - if that's so then they must support a region by region vote allowing those regions who wish to remain in the uk to do so.
attributes.additional_details: After the eu referendum regional parties jumped on the bandwagon by turning a uk vote in to a countries vote all to further their own agendas. That's fine however if regions within those countries want to remain in the uk they should not be denied their democratic right to do so.

attributes.action: Ban the use of in game purchases for non-permanent downloads
attributes.background: The gaming industry is slowly being ruined by games that are paid, yet have objectives or objectives that are almost inachievable without paying more. We therefore call for legislation to ban these purchases for this virtual cash. By this we do not mean paid permanent addons or expansions.
attributes.additional_details: For example: You buy a game. You spend £40. Then you start playing and you pretty much get forced or pressured to buy 'virtual cash' to get certain things in the game that is free dlc but so overpriced in the games' currency that achievement of this is only possible through either excessive play to near extremes or take the easy route and pay your hard earned cash to 'quick buy' this. Not only is this discrimination to those who have less money but its ruining games and must therefore be banned.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to show a Nazi-style swastika tattoo.
attributes.background: Sporting a Nazi swastika tattoo is as much a hate crime as speaking such sentiments. They should be made illegal if they are visible and tattoo parlours should be punished under the law by fines and prison sentences.
attributes.additional_details:
Swastikas are illegal in Germany and should be illegal in the UK too.
Let us not forget the hundreds of thousands of people who lost their lives fighting Nazism in the last world war and people who think they are somehow being patriotic by having these symbols of hatred engraved in their skin are actually just spitting on their graves.

attributes.action: Allow students aged 16+ whose parents receive financial aid to gain employment.
attributes.background: Students who's parents receive financial aid from the governments benefits system should be allowed to gain employment as they currently are not. If a parent or career receives benefits then the house hold income must stay the same to what is provided by the government.
attributes.additional_details: By allowing students to gain employment it allows them to learn financial sustainability and also gives them vital work experience which is widely needed to gain future employment. I am a 17 year old student who has to volunteer to use up spare time as I cant gain employment. I would like to earn my own money but cant due to legal reasons. Even if I could only earn a certain amount would be better than none. So please help me with this petition and sign and share to gain work rights for students

attributes.action: To let 13-17 year olds vote.
attributes.background: I think after the European referendum, people have now realisd the real consequence of the outcome but what people don't understand is that it will affect our children's futures. They should have the right to vote to protect their futures and decide what is right.

attributes.action: Parliament should defer their recess until Article 50 is instigated.
attributes.background: In the light of the major decisions facing this country and pressures from EU Members, require that Parliament defer their recess until the negotiations with the EU over the referendum result, MPs vote on accepting referendum and instigation of Article 50

attributes.action: have a general election and a  referendum on the eu membership
attributes.background: as i don't believe people had the full facts of what they were doing and what would happen as the truth was not told

attributes.action: Make a hotel for refugees
attributes.background: It's so important to help with the refugee crisis that I decided to help, I want to help turn an old field or old building into a nice beautiful hotel for refugees coming from poor war torn countries.

attributes.action: Spend £250 million on our Healthcare
attributes.background: After the destructive Brexit our economy and currency have fallen and the promises made for our healthcare have been broken and now we need to spend £250 million pounds right!
attributes.additional_details: We hope this raises national attention as we want a better Britain and through this money being spend properly we can start straight away.

attributes.action: Reduce current state pensions to pay for any Brexit short fall in Gov' Finances
attributes.background: The majority of over 60's voted for Brexit, the financial impacts of which are to be born by younger generations (loss of access to single market, tightening job markets etc). If there is any financial short fall in Gov' finances due to Brexit it should be paid for by the baby boomers

attributes.action: A 30 hour working week, also make any extra hours worked payable in overtime.
attributes.background: I work in hospitality, and have realised that the people working in hotels are overworked and very underpaid. But not only in this industry, lorry drivers, security guards shopworkers, every industry.

attributes.action: Only leave EU after an agreement in principle ensuring zero tariff barriers.
attributes.background:
There is  need to ensure the UK has access to the European single market without suffering tariffs.

I believe tariffs will lead to job losses in automotive, aerospace and other manufacturing industries.

attributes.action: Not allow people over 60 to vote in referendums or other elections.
attributes.background: Many elections including the EU referendum will mainly affect people who are currently working. Only people between 18-60 should be able to vote as the outcome is going to only affect them especially people aged 18-30 as it is there future which could be at stake.
attributes.additional_details: In the recent EU referendum, according to YouGov, 75% of people aged 18-25 voted to remain apart of the EU. It's their future which is going to affected by older people who may not still be around for the outcome of the referendum.

attributes.action: Scotland should hold a second independence referendum within 6 months.
attributes.background: The Scottish people should be given an opportunity to choose between remaining in the EU or the United Kingdom. From England's perspective this issue needs resolving quickly so that negotiations with the EU can proceed without uncertainty over Scotland's position.

attributes.action: Declare EU referendum invalid.
attributes.background:
The EU referendum result is invalid and void.
Reasons:
1. 52% of a 72% turnout is only 37% of the eligible electorate.
2. UK citizens resident in EU over 15 years 
were not included in the electorate although these citizens are directly affected by this decision.

attributes.action: Ban HGV's on road,6pm Friday to 6am Monday,June to August,for holiday traffic.
attributes.background: This proposal would considerably ease congestion in the holiday season,and has been shown to work in Sweden.Goods deliveries can be scheduled during the rest of the week with minimal disruption .

attributes.action: Move government offices and jobs out of London and spread them across the UK
attributes.background: The vote to leave the EU has clearly shown that London does not connect politically and emotionally as it should with the rest of the U.K. Government offices and jobs should be distributed across Britain to bring the decision makers of this country closer to those they work on behalf of.

attributes.action: Introduce points based system for citizens of non-neighbouring countries.
attributes.background: Introduce points based system for all prospective immigrants who are not citizens of our immediate neighbouring countries (Ireland, France, Iceland, Belgium, Netherlands, Spain, Denmark, Norway, Germany and Sweden. (List of countries to be debated.))

attributes.action: Ensure sovereignty cannot be transferred from parliament without a referendum.
attributes.background: When we leave the EU the power to make and enforce laws will be returned to the UK parliament and courts.  We need legislation to ensure that in future no government can transfer any aspect of sovereignty away from the UK parliament and courts without a referendum.
attributes.additional_details: The power of the UK parliament and courts to make and enforce legislation has been gradually eroded over 40 years of EU membership.  Now that we are at last getting these powers back we need legislation affirming that sovereignty, that is to say the power to make and enforce our own laws, belongs to the people and to ensure that in future no government can transfer any aspect of sovereignty away from the UK parliament and courts without the consent of the people through a referendum.

attributes.action: Allow students (12-16 age) to vote in the (second) EU Referendum
attributes.background: It's important for students to vote in the EU referendum  because it affects their life and their future life.They came here or born here for a better life (education+job) and they are more used to EU lifestyle
attributes.additional_details:
The pound rate has already gone down meaning UK will be badly financially affected.UK won't be able to trade in EU countries.Pupil from other European countries won't be able to migrate in UK and make our country proud.Example:Mo Farah,who is a migrant who made Britain PROUD.
Remember a quote from a girl "It's better to be part of something that is bigger than yourself" Would you like to be alone for your whole life or be with someone who will support you?
"Be safe and remain in EU"

attributes.action: Hold another EU referendum for voters aged 16 to 35
attributes.background: As we are the future let us have a say in our future

attributes.action: Cut down University fees to £6,000
attributes.background: Kids/teenagers in this generation want to do well for the future and to do that they need to go University. But how will they go University if the University fee's are higher than they used to be? What if the fees go higher?

attributes.action: Make it law that only one referendum can be held on an issue in a 5 year period
attributes.background: Following the result of the EU referendum which took months of campaigning and cost millions of taxpayer's pounds, some people who voted remain are attempting to have a 2nd referendum called because they weren't happy with the majority vote. A referendum should be a one time vote on an issue.
attributes.additional_details: A 2nd EU referendum would cost millions of pounds more of tax payers money and be inflicted on a public who generally don't have the appetite for a 2nd referendum. This would be the case in future referendums on other issues too as a precedent would be set now if a 2nd referendum was called.

attributes.action: In a 2nd EU referendum, only those whom did not vote initially may take part.
attributes.background: It is the only way which is fair.

attributes.action: Negotiate with EU to allow UK/EU passports to give full EU passage until expired
attributes.background: UK passport holders need the right of passage within existing EU territories using our UK/EU passport in the same way as we use Pre Referendum

attributes.action: Block retrospective changes to the European Referendum Act 2015
attributes.background: The referendum to leave the European Union was carried out fairly and in line with the following act; European Union Referendum Act 2015. We the undersigned petition that this act is not ammended retrospectively and no provisions made for a minimum turnout to be achieved for results to be binding.

attributes.action: UK referendums to last a minimum of ten years, before repeating.
attributes.background: Scottish independence and EU referendum results to remain law for a minimum of ten years, along with any others which may follow.

attributes.action: Hold a second referendum in England and Wales only
attributes.background: Scotland have voted to be part of the UK and part of EU. England and Wales have voted to leave the EU. The second referendum question should be in England and Wales only and should ask
attributes.additional_details: "Should England and Wales continue to be part of a United Kingdom that is part of the EU or be in independent country outside the EU?"

attributes.action: UK to hold a new EU referendum if Scotland leave the UK before Brexit.
attributes.background: If Scotland vote leave the UK before the EU exit the UK public should have a new EU referendum where they can consider these significantly changed circumstances.

attributes.action: EU Independence referendums for British cities and regions
attributes.background: To allow British cities and regions to hold Independence referendums and be able to choose individual EU membership. Allow individual cities and regions to group together to form a united group based on their views.

attributes.action: Lower the voting age to 16 and stop over 65+ voting
attributes.background: The voting age should be lowered to 16 and over 65+ voting should be stopped

attributes.action: Vote against any act of Parliament related to EU exit in the next 3 months
attributes.background: A referendum is for guidance to our elected representatives - it does not absolve MPs from using their judgement. The will of the people is divided and not settled: the UK majority was only 3.8% and the future of the Union is in jeopardy. As the implications become clearer Public opinion may shift.

attributes.action: The public to decide what 10 issues they want addressing and in which priority.
attributes.background:
So in a nutshell, a system which allows the people’s top 10 issues to be listed, prioritised and given measurable performance criteria with dated milestones for interim measurement.

These issues would be updated at each new election or after coming out of the EU.
attributes.additional_details:
All parties would have same top 10 KIP's which would give consistency and allow performance to be easily measured and compared by the average person.

Currently, all the different party manifestoes are complied by themselves and can’t be easily cross-referenced. This means performance measurement is not easy for the average person.

Obviously the parties they would have all the other issues which can be prioritised and outlined in their own way.

attributes.action: Reaffirm and support equality and worker's rights in post-EU Britain.
attributes.background:
Following the vote to leave the EU, it is likely that the UK will cease to be bound by EU laws, which underpin vital legal protections for British citizens.

The undersigned call upon MPs to reaffirm those acts such as the Employment Rights Act (1996) and Equality Act (2010).
attributes.additional_details:
The undersigned also ask MPs to reject weakening of principles established in EU laws such as:
The Working Time Regulations, 
The Pregnant Workers Directive, 
The Parental Leave Directive, 
The Information and Consultation of Employees Directive (adopted as the Works Council Directive in UK law), 
The Equality Framework Directive, 
The Race Equality Directive, 
The Equal Treatment Directive, 
The Insolvency Protection Directive

attributes.action: Make it mandatory for smart meters to work regardless of supplier
attributes.background: I phoned B Gas and requested to change our gas meter to a smart meter. They stated that unless I bring my electricity to them they can't provide a smart meter. They further stated that if I change the supplier at any time the smart meter will not function due to their accounting system.
attributes.additional_details: All accounting systems are now universal and I feel the Select Committee should question British Gas. Why do they insist on customers bringing their electric supply and not install a smart meter for gas supply only for which they are supplier to the property? It is a very serious issue and I humbly request the Chairman of the Select Committee to question British Gas. I do want a Smart Meter installed without any conditions attached. There is clear indication of the MONOPOLY for energy supply.

attributes.action: Establish extradition treaties so British victims of crime are supported.
attributes.background: I want to raise the issue of the safety of British Nationals and their families overseas and develop on the international extradition treaties and assistance that is in place.
attributes.additional_details: If you or a member of your family has been subjected to a crime a suspected criminal can flee to another country or back to the UK that has no treaty in place and will not face any criminal proceedings.

attributes.action: Stop risking our lives and health. Set up a royal commission to reform the NHS.
attributes.background: I am a retired medical doctor and have seen standards in health care deteriorate over several decades. My own experience and that of family and friends have reinforced that view. It is time to do something positive.
attributes.additional_details: Letter to The Sunday Times November 20, 2016 by over 60 consultants calling for a royal commission to cure the NHS. Leading article in the same issue by Sarah-Kate Templeton: 'We must think the unpalatable to stop death of NHS say doctors'. Owen Paterson's report in October 2016 comparing the UK's NHS with other systems in the West. It found that 46,000 people died unnecessarily each year because of failings in our health service.

attributes.action: Introduce 2 part practical driving test, with the inclusion of a motorway test.
attributes.background:
Motorists lack of knowledge of the Highway Code is creating a culture of dangerous driving, which is likely to be the cause of many accidents.

I would like to see the current driving test revised to introduce a new 
2nd part that tests a motorists practical competence of motorway driving.
attributes.additional_details:
A learner driver is prohibited from using a motorway, and their first use of a motorway will only be after they have passed their driving test. Drivers need to be tested on their practical competence and application of the rules before being allowed on motorways alone. 

On a daily basis I witness motorist's breaching rules 264, 267 & 268 of the Highway Code which cover lane discipline and overtaking. DoT report of road traffic accidents shows an increase of people killed or seriously injured.

attributes.action: Introduce "tax free allowance" after working 37.5 hours or more per week
attributes.background: Every year, thousands of hard working people work 50/60 hour weeks to supplement their pay and are taxed to high heaven. If someone works hard, should they have their reward taken from them? People should not be taxed for working extra.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to do under the speed limit (when there's no traffic)
attributes.background: It's illegal to do over the speed limit because you could crash and/or kill someone BUT people doing under the speed limit can be just as bad.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been lots of times when people have been doing the speed limit and had to brake hard because a learner or unconfident driver is doing half or under half the speed limit.

AND times when people do the national speed limit on country roads and they come around a corner to find someone doing 20mph. It's not safe.

It also causes traffic and delays on the roads

attributes.action: The Government immediately brings the Crime and Courts Act 2013 s.40 into force.
attributes.background: Parliament enacted s.40(6) “This section does not apply until such time as a body is first recognised as an approved regulator”. IMPRESS is an approved regulator. Secretaries of State say, ‘The time is not yet right’. Further consultation defies the will of Parliament: an abuse of government power.
attributes.additional_details:
If a TV/radio programme treats you unfairly and/or unwarrantably infringes your privacy, you have a right to complain to the independent Ofcom.  The Press should also be accountable without costs risk to the complainant: but they continue to complain and lobby!
See: IMPRESS http://tinyurl.com/zcy5q36
HackedOff: http://tinyurl.com/jag72kt for positive views and rebuttal of Press claims and the merits of IPSO.
Voices of victims  HackedOff: http://tinyurl.com/j7wuvgk and http://tinyurl.com/zxhvrr3

attributes.action: Reading Prison as an Enterprise Zone for new Businesses.
attributes.background: This petition proposes the multiuse development of Reading Prison. The Grade II-listed building would be used as a ‘Business Incubator’ where start-up companies share communal infrastructure but operate within a designated space themselves. The remaining site would be a residential development.
attributes.additional_details:
This site is perfect for new businesses, with access to the station as well as supporting industries in the surrounding area.
Existing centres of innovation (The University and Business parks) could be sources of collaboration.
Ernst and Young forecasts Reading to be the fastest growing local economy in the UK, making this a pivotal moment in Reading's economic future.
The prison site will enable a diverse range of new businesses to develop, further spreading Reading’s prosperity.

attributes.action: Cyclists should have legally registered identification plates on their cycles.
attributes.background: This is to enable identification of, and consequences for, cyclists who break road traffic laws and cause minor or major road incidents.
attributes.additional_details: There have been previous attempts to pass such laws but they have been generally tied in with the introduction of proposed insurance and road tax for cyclists.  Most cyclists, however, also own cars and so the concept of paying for road tax and insurance twice is an incredibly controversial one.  In order to keep this proposal straightforward, I am suggesting simply that cycle registration becomes compulsory in the same way car registration is, as a means of identification.

attributes.action: charge UKentrants £10 a week insurance to cover possible use of our NHS
attributes.background: At the moment a lot of money is lost from free treatment and chasing for payment for treatment with a set duty of £10 a week Im sure the NHS would be a lot better off

attributes.action: BLUE BADGES SHOULD BE GIVEN TO PEOPLE WHO ARE AUTISTIC
attributes.background: AUTISM SHOULD BE AN ELIGIBLE DISABILITY FOR A BLUE BADGE
